meanings.definition: To decline to accept or comply with something.
meanings.sent1: She refused to eat the broccoli at dinner.
meanings.sent2: He refused to go to bed without reading a bedtime story.
meanings.sent3: The cat refused to wear the tiny hat, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The old tree refused to let go of its last autumn leaf.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn door handle refused to turn, trapping us inside.

meanings.definition: To indicate unwillingness to do something.
meanings.sent1: The child refused to share his toys with his sister.
meanings.sent2: She refused to participate in the dance recital due to stage fright.
meanings.sent3: The dog playfully refused to fetch the ball, teasing its owner.
meanings.sent4: The river refused to freeze, flowing freely even in winter.
meanings.sent5: The tired engine refused to start, leaving us stranded on the road.

meanings.definition: To reject something as unacceptable or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: He refused the offer of a second piece of cake, watching his diet.
meanings.sent2: She refused to buy the damaged goods at the store.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater refused to try the new exotic dish, sticking to familiar foods.
meanings.sent4: The artist refused to compromise his vision for the painting, staying true to his style.
meanings.sent5: The detective refused to believe the suspect's alibi, sensing deception.
